Key Match Events: Jamal Musiala scored a solo wondergoal as Germany thumped Hungary 5-0.
Niclas Fullkrug, Florian Wirtz, Aleksandar Pavlovic, and Kai Havertz were also on target for Germany.
Germany put Hungary under pressure from the start, with a goal-line clearance by Dominik Szoboszlai and a missed chance by Fullkrug.
Fullkrug made amends by scoring the first goal with a tap-in inside the six-yard box.
Havertz had two chances to double Germany’s lead before the break, hitting the bar and sending a curled effort wide.
Musiala scored Germany's second goal after driving from the halfway line and holding off two defenders.
Musiala set up Wirtz for Germany's third goal, who squeezed the ball past Peter Gulacsi.
Pavlovic added a fourth goal with a scrappy strike that squeezed under the goalkeeper.
Havertz scored the fifth goal from a penalty after being hauled down in the box.
Ter Stegen made a crucial save to protect Germany's clean sheet.
Post-Match Reflections: Germany got their UEFA Nations League campaign off to a winning start.
Julien Nagelsmann will be delighted with the clean sheet and the overall performance.
